page.title: 01Principal features La Moye.
page.content: This area is a rocky promontary situated at the south-western tip of Jersey. It is a granite area with rugged cliffs,a soft gentle landscape inland and much scenic beauty. The terrain is rather flat and the soils are light and poor. It is windswept and this is especially due to the prevailing winds which are south - westerly and which are particularly strong in autumn and winter. The land consists mainly of small farms, small fields, housing and several small valleys. There is evidence of archaelogical occupation of the Neolithic period and a new site (still undated) has been found. Most people are employed outside the area which makes it something of a "dormitory" area, but others are occupied in agriculture and tourism.
